intro: Glenniea unijuga f. fuscata, commonly known as the dark-flowered glenniea, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically dark in color, often ranging from deep purple to black. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
